column3: Name: “Table 1 of 1 on page 100 of 124”
Table: 92
Capital Improvement Plan
DESCRIPTION
Land acquisitions and actions to facilitate redevelopment of
College Court.
Remove old, deteriorating and obsolete facilities and build
new facilities that meet code and ADA standards. These
facilities will include new restrooms, concession building, five
new picnic shelters and a gazebo type structure on one of the
newly developed lots. Landscape areas along boardwalk,
replace gates and signage. Build new beach maintenance
support storage area and small office building at old Beach
School vacant lot. Build a new boardwalk from Point Comfort
to the Fishing Pier.
Proposed streetscape improvements along Pembroke Ave.
Include upgrades to sidewalks, curbs and gutters, and street
trees from Old Buckroe to Seaboard Ave.
Construct parking garage and underground staging area to
improve the appearance of the Coliseum's back of house.
Add or improve landscaping on Settler's Landing Road,
Armistead Avenue and Lincoln and Eaton Streets.
Conduct an overall historical assessment and conditional
survey of the fort, buildings and structures. This will facilitate
public and private upkeep, preservation and adaptive re-use
of buildings and other resources determined to have historic
value to our community.
Acquire key properties around Grant Park to create street
connections that will provide additional access to the park as
well as increase visibility and surveillance to the Park.
The proposal is to make streetscape improvements, including
installing sidewalks where none currently exists, along
Kecoughtan Road from Powhatan Parkway to Hampton
Roads Ave.
